info.description: This service offers the ability to retrieve security prices via specifying a price hierarchy or price purpose. This can be used to retrieve a single price for a specific date, time series of prices for a date range, or month-end prices for a date range.
info.title: Price

post.description:
Retrieve prices by price hierarchy for a specific date. Asset ids per request are capped at 12000 for large, one-off requests. The recommended batch size for sustained loads is 2000 asset ids/request.
(-- api-linter: core::0132::response-message-name=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)

(-- api-linter: aladdin::9016::query-custom-method-http=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

responseState.title: Represents response message of api call

reason.description: represents a common reason for failure of all records.

enumsState.description:
- STATE_UNSPECIFIED: unspecified
 - STATE_SUCCESS: SUCCESS
 - STATE_FAILURE: FAILURE
 - STATE_PARTIAL_FAILURE: PARTIAL_FAILURE
 - STATE_ADL_FAILURE: ADL_FAILURE
 - STATE_DB_FAILURE: DB_FAILURE
 - STATE_NO_DATA_FOUND: NO_DATA_FOUND
 - STATE_INVALID_REQUEST: INVALID_REQUEST
 - STATE_ADL_CONNECTION_ISSUE: ADL_CONNECTION_ISSUE
 - STATE_DB_CONNECTION_ISSUE: DB_CONNECTION_ISSUE
enumsState.title: State

assetId.title:
string type aladdin id field describes the aladdin security identifier
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)

pricingDate.title: date type PriceDate field describes the begin date representative of the prices fields

purpose.title:
string type Purpose describes the purpose of the defined price in Aladdin, it is typically associated with a source
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)

source.title:
string type Source describes the source of the defined price in Aladdin, it is typically associated with a purpose
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)

closePrice.title:
float type close price describes the market close price of the aladdin security
e.g. for equities its typically exchange provided official close, for fixed income its evaluated bid, for derivatives its Blackrock pricing convention.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

openPrice.title:
float type Open price describes the market open price, typically the price which the security first traded at the open of the price date. 
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

highPrice.title:
float type Highest Price describes the highest price at which the security has traded during the price date
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

midPrice.title:
float type mid price describes the average of bid_price and ask_price and this is calculated only where both values are available and applicable to selective security types.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

lowPrice.title:
float type Lowest Price describes the lowest price at which the security has traded during the price date
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

highPriceTwelveMonth.title:
float type Twelfth Month High describes the highest price for the last 12month range
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

lowPriceTwelveMonth.title:
float type Twelfth Month High describes the lowest price for the last 12month range 
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

bidPrice.title:
float type Bid Price describes market bid price
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

askPrice.title:
float type Ask price describes market ask price
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

dirtyPriceIndicator.title: Boolean type Dirty Price indicator flag describes whether the close price is clean (N) or dirty (Y), applicable for Fixed Income and Derivatives

settleDate.description: date type Settlement Date describes the settle date attached to the price and applicable to selective security types.

lastTradeDate.title: date type Last Trade Date describes the actual trade date of close price, this should be same as the close price date, however they would differ incases where the price is rolled for the price date using last available price

v2AssetPriceHierarchy.title: Retrieve Asset price by price hierarchy

assetPrice.title:
Common Input parameters like lookback_days, asset_id, price_date
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

assetPriceGroup.description:
Price_group like NAV.
This is a mandatory field.

assetPrice.title:
Common Input parameters like  lookback_days, asset_ids, price_date    
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating new version of the API with double --)

purpose.title:
string type Purpose describes the purpose of the defined price in Aladdin, it is typically associated with a source
purpose like REF.
This is a mandatory field.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)

assetIds.description:
array of string type aladdin id field describes the aladdin security identifier. Multiple assetIds can be passed here.
This is a mandatory field.

pricingDate.description:
PricingDate is a Date type field that  describes the date representative of the prices fields.
This is a mandatory field.

daysLookback.description:
Indicates the range of days to look back to if the price on the specified price_date is not available.
The call will return pricing for the most recent date beginning with price_date, and go back in 1 day increments up to 
the set number of daysLookback until a price is available. If there is no price available, the API will 
return an empty response. Example: If the price_date is 5th November, and dayslookBack is 3, the call will return the
5th of November price, if available. If not, it will go to the previous date, i.e. 4th November, up to 3 days back until a price is available.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterAssetPricesHierarchies' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterAssetPricesHierarchies' must match the call that provided the page
token.

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of Prices to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 100
Prices will be returned. The maximum value is 100; values
above 100 will be coerced to 100.

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterAssetPricesPurposes' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterAssetPricesPurposes' must match the call that provided the page
token.

pageSize.description:
This is the maximum number of Prices(per page) to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 100
Prices will be returned. The maximum value is 100; values
above 100 will be coerced to 100.

timeSeriesAssetPrice.title: Common Input parameters like asset_ids, price_begin_date, price_end_date

assetPriceGroup.description:
Price_group like NAV.
This is a mandatory field.

timeSeriesAssetPrice.title: Common Input parameters like asset_ids, price_begin_date, price_end_date

purpose like REF.
This is a mandatory field.

 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)

timeSeriesAssetPrice.title: Common Input parameters like asset_ids, price_begin_date, price_end_date

assetPriceGroup.description:
Price_group like NAV.
This is a mandatory field.

v2TimeSeriesPricePurpose.title: Retrieve Asset Price by Purpose using TimeSeries

timeSeriesAssetPrice.title: Common Input parameters like asset_ids, price_begin_date, price_end_date

purpose.title:
string type Purpose describes the purpose of the defined price in Aladdin, it is typically associated with a source
purpose like REF.
This is a mandatory field.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are creating another version of an existing API --)

assetIds.description:
array of string type aladdin id field describes the aladdin security identifier. Multiple assetIds can be passed here.
This is a mandatory field.

pricingBeginDate.description: BeginDate is a Date type field that specifies the start date from where we want to see the prices.

pricingEndDate.description:
EndDate is a Date type field that specifies the end date till where we want to see the prices.
One of the two dates should be present in the request. Either begin or end. Both can be provided as well.

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.
